function.name: forest-get-name
function.summary: This function returns the name of the specified forest, given the forest ID.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. If the ID does not correspond to a valid forest ID, then an exception is thrown.

function.name: forest-get-host
function.summary: This function returns the ID of the host in which the specified forest resides.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-get-id
function.summary: This function returns the ID of the forest with the specified name, from the specified configuration. The difference between this function and xdmp:forest()is that the ID from this function can come from a forest that has not yet been saved (that is, from a forest that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files).

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the forest.

function.name: forest-get-enabled
function.summary: This function returns the enabled state of the specified forest.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-get-data-directory
function.summary: This function returns the name of the data directory of the specified forest.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-get-large-data-directory
function.summary: This function returns the name of the large data directory of the specified forest.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-get-failover-enable
function.summary: This function returns the state of whether failover is enabled for the specified forest.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-get-updates-allowed
function.summary: This function returns the state of what kinds of updates are allowed for the specified forest.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-get-failover-hosts
function.summary: This function returns the IDs of the hosts defined as failover hosts for this forest. The order in which the hosts IDs are returned is significant, with the first ID being the primary host, the second (if there is one) being the secondary, and so on.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-set-host
function.summary: This function sets a forest configuration to a new host.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The host ID of the new host.

function.name: forest-set-enabled
function.summary: This function sets the enabled state for a forest configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-set-failover-enable
function.summary: This function sets the forest failover enabled state for a forest configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

function.name: forest-set-updates-allowed
function.summary: This function sets the updates-allowed state for a forest configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

The new updates-allowed state of the forest. Must be one of allfor all updates allowed, delete-onlyfor only deletes allowed, read-onlyfor no updates allowed and to cause updating transactions to abort immediately, flash-backupfor no updates allowed and to make updating transactions retry for a time period specified in the group's retry timeout.

function.name: forest-add-failover-host
function.summary: This function adds a failover host to the list of failover hosts for the specified forest in the specified configuration. If there are already any hosts specified, this host is added to the end of the list of failover hosts.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The host ID(s) for the host(s) you want to restart. For example, xdmp:host()returns the ID for the current host.

function.name: forest-delete-failover-host
function.summary: This function deletes the specified failover host(s) from the failover-host list in the specified configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The host ID(s) for the host(s) you want to delete. For example, xdmp:host()returns the ID for the current host.

function.name: forest-delete
function.summary: This function deletes the configuration for the specified forest from the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
One or more forest ids. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

If set to true, deletes the data directory as well as the configuration (Note: all documents in the forest will be permanently deleted). If set to false, deletes only the configuration information, leaving the forest data in the data directory on disk.

function.usage: Any forest whose ID you pass into this function must not be attached to a database when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to detach the forest, do so in a separate transaction before using them in this function.

function.name: forest-create
function.summary: This function creates a new forest configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the forest. The must be unique for all forests in the cluster.
The ID of the host (for example, xdmp:host()for the current host.
The optional data directory of the forest. If no directory is specified, then it will be a private forest.
The optional directory where large objects are stored. If no directory is specified, then large objects will be stored in DATA_DIR/Forests/FOREST_NAME/Large.

function.name: forest-copy
function.summary: This function creates a new forest specification with the same settings as the forest with the specified ID. The new forest configuration will have the specified name. It copies the forest configuration, but does not copy the forest data.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest")specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The name for the new forest.
The optional data directory of the forest. If no directory is specified, then it will be a private forest.
The optional directory where large objects are stored. If no directory is specified, then large objects will be stored in DATA_DIR/Forests/FOREST_NAME/Large.
An optional directory located on a fast storage device, such as an SSD.

function.name: forest-get-backups
function.summary: This function returns the scheduled backups for the specified forest from the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the forest (for example, xdmp:forest("myforest")).

function.name: forest-weekly-backup
function.summary: This function constructs a weekly scheduled backup.

params.param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
The how many weeks between each backup.
The day(s) of the week. Must be a sequence of zero or more of monday, tuesday, wednesday, thusday, friday, saturday, sunday.
A time for the scheduled backup to start.

function.name: forest-monthly-backup
function.summary: This function constructs a monthly scheduled backup.

params.param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
The number of months to elapse between each backup.
The day of the month the backup will happen (between 1 and 31)
A time for the scheduled backup to start.

function.name: forest-one-time-backup
function.summary: This function constructs a one-time backup.

params.param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
The starting dateTime of the scheduled backup.

function.name: forest-add-backup
function.summary: This function adds scheduled backup specifications for a forest to a configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the forest (for example, xdmp:forest("myforest")).
The scheduled backup specification(s), typically the result of an admin:forest-one-time-backupor an admin:forest-monthly-backupor an admin:forest-weekly-backupcall

function.name: forest-delete-backup
function.summary: This function deletes scheduled backup specifications for a forest from a configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the forest (for example, xdmp:forest("myforest")).
The scheduled backup(s) to delete. Typically, the result of an admin:forest-get-backupscall.

function.name: host-get-id
function.summary: This function return the ID for the specified host from the configuration. The difference between this function and xdmp:host()is that the ID from this function can come from a host that has not yet been saved (that is, from a host that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files). This ID enables you to completely configure a newly created host without the need to first save the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the host. If the host is the current host, xdmp:host-name()returns the name.

function.name: host-get-name
function.summary: This function returns the name for the host with the specified ID.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-idcall.

function.name: host-get-group
function.summary: This function returns the group ID for the host with the specified ID.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-idcall.

function.name: host-get-port
function.summary: This function returns the bind port for the host with the specified ID.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-idcall.

function.name: host-set-name
function.summary: This function changes the name of an existing host to the newly specified value.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-idcall.
The new name of the host.

function.name: host-set-group
function.summary: This function changes the group to which an existing host belongs to the newly specified value.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-idcall.
The new group ID value (typically from a admin:group-get-idcall.

function.usage: Any group whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the group, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

function.name: host-set-port
function.summary: This function changes the bind port value for the host to the newly specified value.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-idcall.
The new bind port value.

function.name: appserver-get-type
function.summary: This function returns the type of appserver with the specified ID. It will be either "http", "xdbc", or "WebDAV".

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-group-id
function.summary: This function returns the ID of the specified App Server's group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-host-ids
function.summary: This function returns the ID(s) of the hosts the specified App Server's is currently running on.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-id
function.summary: This function returns the ID of the specified App Server. The difference between this function and xdmp:server()is that the ID from this function can come from an appserver that has not yet been saved (that is, from an appserver that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files). This ID enables you to completely configure a newly created appserver without the need to first save the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The optional group-ids in which to restrict the appserver ids returned. If no group-id is specified, this function will return all matching appservers across all groups.
The name of the App Server.

function.name: appserver-get-name
function.summary: This function returns the name of the appserver with the specified ID.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-root
function.summary: This function returns the root for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-port
function.summary: This function returns the port for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-modules-database
function.summary: This function returns the ID of the database set as the modules database for the specified database.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

usage.p: This function throws an exception if the specified App Server is a WebDAV server (because WebDAV servers do not use a modules database).

function.name: appserver-get-database
function.summary: This function returns the ID of the database to which the App Server is set to execute queries against for the specified database.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-last-login
function.summary: This function returns the ID of the database to which the App Server stores users' last login information.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-display-last-login
function.summary: This function returns the value of the whether or not the appserver should display users' last login information.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-address
function.summary: This function returns the IP address of the App Server configuration. The default is 0.0.0.0.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-backlog
function.summary: This function returns the socket listen backlog setting for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-threads
function.summary: This function returns the maximum number of threads configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-request-timeout
function.summary: This function returns the request timeout value configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-keep-alive-timeout
function.summary: This function returns the keep alive timeout value configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-session-timeout
function.summary: This function returns the session timeout value configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-default-time-limit
function.summary: This function returns the default time limit value configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-max-time-limit
function.summary: This function returns the max time limit value configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-pre-commit-trigger-depth
function.summary: This function returns the pre commit trigger depth value configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-pre-commit-trigger-limit
function.summary: This function returns the pre commit trigger limit value configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-collation
function.summary: This function returns the collation URI set in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-authentication
function.summary: This function returns the authentication scheme (basic, digest, digestbasic, or application-level) configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-default-user
function.summary: This function returns the default user value configured for the specified App Server. The default user only is used with application-level authentication.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-privilege
function.summary: This function returns the privilege ID for the specified App Server. If no privilege is configured, It returns 0.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-concurrent-request-limit
function.summary: This function returns the concurrent request limit for any user for the specified App Server. 0 indicates no bound on the number of concurrent requests.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-log-errors
function.summary: This function returns the value of the log errors setting configured for this App Server, where true indicates that the App Server will send uncaught exceptions to the ErrorLog.txtfile, and false indicates that it will not.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-debug-allow
function.summary: This function returns the value of debug allow setting configured for this App Server, where true indicates that the App Server will allow queries to be debugged, and false indicates that it will not.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-profile-allow
function.summary: This function returns the value of the profile allow setting configured for this App Server, where true indicates that the App Server will allow queries to be profiled, and false indicates that it will not.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-default-xquery-version
function.summary: This function returns the value of the default xquery version configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-multi-version-concurrency-control
function.summary: This function returns the value of the multi version concurrency control option configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-output-sgml-character-entities
function.summary: This function returns the value for the output sgml character entities setting for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-output-encoding
function.summary: This function returns the value for the output encoding setting for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-error-handler
function.summary: This function returns the path to the error handler configured for this App Server. If no error handler is configured, returns the empty string.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-url-rewriter
function.summary: This function returns the path to the URL rewriter configured for this App Server. If no URL rewriter is configured, returns the empty string.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-enabled
function.summary: This function returns the enabled state for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-schemas
function.summary: This function returns the value of any schemas definitions predefined for the specified App Server. If none are defined, returns the empty sequence.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-namespaces
function.summary: This function returns the value of any namespace definitions predefined for the specified App Server. If none are defined, returns the empty sequence.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-static-expires
function.summary: This function returns the value of the "expires" HTTP header for static content to expire after this many seconds port for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-compute-content-length
function.summary: This function returns the value of whether the WebDAV server computes content length.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-set-name
function.summary: This function changes the name of an existing App Server to the newly specified value.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new name for the specified App Server.

function.name: appserver-set-root
function.summary: This function changes the root for a specified App Server to the newly specified value.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

The new value for the root. The root must be either a fully qualified path (for example, /space/myRootor c:/space/myRoot) or a relative path (for example, myRoot); relative paths are resolved relative to the directory in which MarkLogic Server is installed.

function.name: appserver-set-port
function.summary: This function changes the port in the configuration for the specified App Server to the specified number. Changing the port is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configurationto save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new port number.

function.name: appserver-set-modules-database
function.summary: This function sets the value in the configuration of modules database for the specified App Server to the specified database ID.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The database ID for the database to set as the modules database. To specify the filesystem, use 0 or "file-system"

function.usage: Any database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

function.name: appserver-set-database
function.summary: This function sets the value in the configuration of the database for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The database ID for the database to set as the database for the specified App Server.

function.usage: Any database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

function.name: appserver-set-last-login
function.summary: This function sets the value in the configuration of the last login database for the specified App Server. If the value is equal to 0, then the last-login feature is disabled for this appserver.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The database ID for the database to set as the database for the specified App Server. To disable the last-login feature, use the empty sequence or 0 for this value

function.usage: Any database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

function.name: appserver-set-display-last-login
function.summary: This function sets the display last login setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A boolean value specifying whether to indicate if the appserver should display last login information.

function.name: appserver-set-address
function.summary: This function changes the IP Address in the configuration for the specified App Server to the specified address. Changing the address is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configurationto save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new value for the IP address for the specified App Server.

function.name: appserver-set-backlog
function.summary: This function sets the value in the configuration of the backlog (the maximum number of pending connections allowed on the HTTP socket) for the specified App Server. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configurationto save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new integer value for the backlog.

function.name: appserver-set-threads
function.summary: This function sets the value in the configuration of the maximum number of threads for the specified App Server. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configurationto save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new integer value for the number of threads.

function.name: appserver-set-request-timeout
function.summary: This function sets the value of the socket request timeout (the number of seconds before the socket times out) in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
An integer specifying the number of seconds before a socket request times out.

function.name: appserver-set-keep-alive-timeout
function.summary: This function sets the keep-alive timeout (the maximum number of second for subsequent socket requests to time out) in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new integer timeout value (specifies the number of seconds).

function.name: appserver-set-session-timeout
function.summary: This function sets the session timeout value (in seconds) in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new integer timeout value (specifies the number of seconds).

function.name: appserver-set-default-time-limit
function.summary: This function sets the default time limit (the maximum total amount of time to service a request before the App Server throws a timeout exception) in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new integer timeout value (specifies the number of seconds).

function.name: appserver-set-max-time-limit
function.summary: This function sets the max time limit (the maximum total amount of time to service a request before the App Server throws a timeout exception) in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new integer timeout value (specifies the number of seconds).

function.name: appserver-set-pre-commit-trigger-depth
function.summary: This function sets the maximum depth (how many triggers can cause other triggers to fire, which in turn cause others to fire, and so on) in the configuration for the specifed App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The maximum depth (how many triggers can cause other triggers to fire, which in turn cause others to fire, and so on) for pre-commit triggers.

function.name: appserver-set-pre-commit-trigger-limit
function.summary: This function sets the value in the configuration for the maximum number of pre-commit triggers a single statement can invoke for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The limit for the number of pre-commit triggers a single statement can invoke.

function.name: appserver-set-collation
function.summary: This function sets the default collation in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A valid collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/).

function.name: appserver-set-authentication
function.summary: This function sets the authentication scheme in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The authentication scheme ( basic, digest, digestbasic, or application-level).

function.name: appserver-set-default-user
function.summary: This function sets the default user (for use with application-level authentication) in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The user ID of the user to set as the default user.

function.name: appserver-set-privilege
function.summary: This function sets an execute privilege in the configuration for the specified App Server. When a privilege is set, the user who makes a request to the App Server must have been granted (via a role, either directly or indirectly) the specified privilege.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The privilege ID of an execute privilege needed to access this App Server.

function.name: appserver-set-concurrent-request-limit
function.summary: This function sets the limit on concurrent requests that any user may have on a particular appserver. Setting the limit to 0 indicates there is no bound on the number of concurrent requests.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The limit of concurrent requests.

function.name: appserver-set-log-errors
function.summary: This function sets the log errors setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A boolean value specifying whether to allow send uncaught exceptions on this App Server to the ErrorLog.txtfile (true) or not (false).

function.name: appserver-set-debug-allow
function.summary: This function sets the debug allow setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A boolean value specifying whether to allow debugging on this App Server (true) or not (false).

function.name: appserver-set-profile-allow
function.summary: This function sets the profile allow setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A boolean value specifying whether to allow profiling on this App Server (true) or not (false).

function.name: appserver-set-default-xquery-version
function.summary: This function sets the default XQuery version setting in the configuration for this App Server. This setting determines the XQuery dialect used in queries against this App Server when one is not explicitly specified in the XQuery version declaration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default XQuery version value, one of 1.0-ml, 1.0, or 0.9-ml.

function.name: appserver-set-multi-version-concurrency-control
function.summary: This function sets the multi version concurrency control value in the configuration for this App Server. This option specifies how the latest timestamp is chosen for lock-free queries. When set to contemporaneous, the server chooses the latest timestamp for which anytransaction is known to have committed, even though there still may be other transactions for that timestamp that have not yet fully committed. Queries will see more timely results, but may block waiting for contemporaneous transactions to fully commit. When set to nonblocking, the server chooses the latest timestamp for which alltransactions are known to have committed, even though there may be a later timestamp for which another transaction has committed. Queries won't block waiting for transactions, but they may see less timely results.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The multi version concurrency control value, one of contemporaneousor nonblocking.

function.name: appserver-set-output-sgml-character-entities
function.summary: This function sets the SGML character entity output setting in the configuration for the specified App Server. The SGML setting determines how characters that can be represented as SGML entites are serialized upon output by default in a query against the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for outputting SGML entities, one of none, default, math, or pub.

function.name: appserver-set-output-encoding
function.summary: This function sets the value for the default output encoding in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for outputting characters. The value must be the name of a valid character set (for example, UTF-8, ASCII, and so on.

function.name: appserver-set-error-handler
function.summary: This function sets the value of the path to the error handler in the configuration for the specified App Server. The path should specify a relative or absolute path to an XQuery module that is executed in the event of any 400 or 500 series HTTP errors (sometime known as a "sorry" server to give the user a clean error page).

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The path to the XQuery main module to execute when 400 or 500 series errors occur on the App Server.

function.name: appserver-set-url-rewriter
function.summary: This function sets the value of the path to the URL rewriter in the configuration for the specified App Server. The path should specify a relative or absolute path to an XQuery module that is executed to rewrite incoming URLs.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The path to the XQuery main module to execute to rewrite URLs.

function.name: appserver-set-enabled
function.summary: This function sets the enabled state in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The enabled state of the App Server to set, true for enabled and false for disabled.

function.name: appserver-set-static-expires
function.summary: This function changes the value of the "expires" HTTP header for a specified App Server to the newly specified value.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new value for the "expires" header.

function.name: appserver-set-compute-content-length
function.summary: This function changes the value whether a WebDAV server computes content length.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The new value for compute content length.

function.name: appserver-get-request-blackouts
function.summary: This function returns the request blackouts specification for the specified appserver from the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the appserver (for example, xdmp:server("myAppserver")).

function.name: appserver-recurring-request-blackout
function.summary: This function constructs a request-blackout specification.

params.param: A sequence of user ID(s) that the request blackout applies too.
A sequence of role ID(s) that the request blackout applies too.
The day(s) of the week. Must be a sequence of zero or more of monday, tuesday, wednesday, thusday, friday, saturday, sunday.
A time for the request blackout to start.
A time for the request blackout to end.
The amount of time for the blackout to last.

function.name: appserver-one-time-request-blackout
function.summary: This function constructs a one-time request-blackout specification.

params.param: A sequence of user ID(s) that the request blackout applies too.
A sequence of role ID(s) that the request blackout applies too.
The starting dateTime of the request blackout.
The ending dateTime of the request blackout.
The amount of time for the blackout to last.

function.name: appserver-add-request-blackout
function.summary: This function adds a request blackout specification for a appserver to a configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the appserver (for example, xdmp:server("myAppserver")).
The request blackout specification(s), typically the result of an admin:appserver-one-time-request-blackoutor an admin:appserver-recurring-request-blackoutcall

function.name: appserver-delete-request-blackout
function.summary: This function deletes a request blackout specification for a appserver from a configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the appserver (for example, xdmp:server("myAppserver")).
The request blackout(s) to delete. Typically, the result of an admin:appserver-get-request-blackoutscall.

function.name: group-schema
function.summary: This function constructs a schema element with the specified prefix and URI.

params.param: The namespace URI for the schema.
The schema location.

function.name: appserver-add-schema
function.summary: This function adds a schema binding definition to the existing schema binding definitions in the configuration for the specified App Server. Schemas with a schema binding definition are automatically imported into queries run against the App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

A list of schema specification elements of the form:
<schema xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <namespace-uri>foo</namespace-uri> <schema-location>/foo.xsd</schema-location> </schema> Typically the result of an admin:group-schemacall.

function.name: appserver-delete-schema
function.summary: This function deletes a schema definition in the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

A list of schema specification elements of the form:
<schema xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <namespace-uri>foo</namespace-uri> <schema-location>/foo.xsd</schema-location> </schema> Typically the result of an admin:group-schemacall.

function.name: group-namespace
function.summary: This function constructs a namespace element with the specified prefix and URI.

params.param: The namespace prefix.
The namespace URI.

function.name: appserver-add-namespace
function.summary: Add one or more namespaces to an App Server configuration, which will predefine the namespace(s) for all requests evaluated against the App Server.

params.param: The configuration for the cluster, typically the result of admin:get-configuration()call.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

A list of namespaces to add. Each namespace specification has the following form:
<namespace xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <prefix>myprefix</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://myuri/forthisprefix</namespace-uri> </namespace>
Typically the result of an admin:group-namespacecall.

function.name: appserver-delete-namespace
function.summary: This function deletes a namespace configuration from the configuration for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

A list of namespaces to add. Each namespace specification has the following form:
<namespace xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <prefix>myprefix</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://myuri/forthisprefix</namespace-uri> </namespace>
Typically the result of an admin:group-namespacecall.

function.name: appserver-delete
function.summary: This function deletes one or more App Servers in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID(s) of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: http-server-create
function.summary: This function creates a new HTTP App Server with the specified name, root, and port in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The name of the App Server. The name must be unique among the App Server names for the group.
The root of the App Server.
The port on which the App Server listens. The port must be available on the host.
The id of the modules database (for example, xdmp:database("Modules")). To specify the filesystem, use 0 or "file-system"
The id of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

function.usage: Any group or database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the group and/or database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

function.name: xdbc-server-create
function.summary: This function creates a new XDBC App Server with the specified name, root, and port in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The name of the App Server. The name must be unique among the App Server names for the group.
The path to the module directory root of this XDBC server.
The port on which the App Server listens. The port must be available on the host.
The id of the modules database (for example, xdmp:database("Modules")). To specify the filesystem, use 0 or "file-system"
The id of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

function.usage: Any group or database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the group and/or database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

function.name: webdav-server-create
function.summary: This function creates a new WebDAV App Server with the specified name, library, and port in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The name of the App Server. The name must be unique among the App Server names for the group.
The root of the App Server.
The port on which the App Server listens. The port must be available on the host.
The id of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

function.usage: Any group or database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the group and/or database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

function.name: appserver-copy
function.summary: This function creates a new App Server specification with the same settings as the App Server with the specified ID. The new App Server configuration will have the specified name. You can copy the App Server to a new one either in the same group (by specifying $old-group-id and $new-group-id with the same group ID) or in a different group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

The optional group ID of the new group to which the App Server is copied. If no ID is provided, the appserver will be copied to the same group it exists in. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new name for the App Server.
The port number for the new App Server.

function.name: taskserver-get-name
function.summary: This function returns the name of the task server for the specified group from the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.name: taskserver-get-threads
function.summary: This function returns the number of threads configured on the task server for the specified group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.name: group-get-id
function.summary: This function returns the ID of the group. The difference between this function and xdmp:group()is that the ID from this function can come from a group that has not yet been saved (that is, from a group that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files). This ID enables you to completely configure a newly created group without the need to first save the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new timeout setting (in seconds).

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

The new timeout setting (in seconds).

function.summary: This function changes the host initial timeout setting (the time the cluster will wait for a host to come online during cluster startup) for the group in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new timeout setting (in seconds).

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new timeout setting (in seconds).

function.summary: This function changes the host system log level setting for the group in the configuration.

The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new log level (must be one of finest, finer, fine, debug, config, info, notice, warning, error, critical, alert, emergency).

function.name: group-set-file-log-level
function.summary: This function changes the host file log level setting for the group in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

The new log level (must be one of finest, finer, fine, debug, config, info, notice, warning, error, critical, alert, emergency).

function.summary: This function changes the rotate log files setting for the group in the configuration.

The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new log level (must be one of never, daily, monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, sunday, monthly).

function.name: group-set-keep-log-files
function.summary: This function changes the keep log files setting for the group in the configuration.

The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new setting (true to enable failover for the group, false to disable it).

function.name: group-set-trace-events-activated
function.summary: This function changes the value for trace events in the group configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new trace event value (true for enabled, false for disabled).

function.name: group-add-schema
function.summary: This function adds a schema binding definition to the existing schema binding definitions in the configuration for the specified Group. Schemas with a schema binding definition are automatically imported into queries run against any App Server in the group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

A list of schema specification elements of the form:
<schema xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <namespace-uri>foo</namespace-uri> <schema-location>/foo.xsd</schema-location> </schema> Typically the result of an admin:group-schemacall.

function.name: group-delete-schema
function.summary: This function deletes a schema binding definition to the existing schema binding definitions in the configuration for the specified Group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

A list of schema specification elements of the form:
<schema xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <namespace-uri>foo</namespace-uri> <schema-location>/foo.xsd</schema-location> </schema> Typically the result of an admin:group-schemacall.

function.name: group-add-namespace
function.summary: Add one or more namespaces to a Group configuration, which will predefine the namespace(s) for all requests evaluated against any App Server in the Group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

A list of namespaces to add. Typically the result of an admin:group-namespacecall.
Each namespace specification has the following form:
<namespace xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <prefix>myprefix</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://myuri/forthisprefix</namespace-uri> </namespace>

function.name: group-delete-namespace
function.summary: This function deletes the specified namespaces from the configuration for the specified group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

A list of namespaces to delete. Each namespace specification has the following form:
<namespace xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <prefix>myprefix</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://myuri/forthisprefix</namespace-uri> </namespace>
Typically the result of an admin:group-namespacecall.

function.name: group-trace-event
function.summary: This function constructs an event element for the specified event name.

params.param: The exact name of the trace event.

function.name: group-add-trace-event
function.summary: This function adds trace events to the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
Zero or more event specifications, which you can construct with the admin:group-trace-eventfunction.

function.name: group-delete-trace-event
function.summary: This function deletes the specified trace events from the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
Zero or more event specifications, which you can construct with the admin:group-trace-eventfunction.

function.name: group-delete
function.summary: This function deletes one or more groups in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The IDs of the groups to be deleted. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.usage: Any group whose ID you pass into this function must not have any hosts belonging to it when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to delete the group, remove its hosts in a separate transaction before calling this function.

function.name: group-create
function.summary: This function creates a new group with the specified name in the configuration. The new group has the default values.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name for the new group.

function.name: group-copy
function.summary: This function creates a new group specification with the same settings as the group with the specified ID. The new group configuration will have the specified name.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The name of the new group to create.

function.name: group-get-audit-enabled

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.name: group-set-audit-enabled
function.summary: This function changes the audit enabled setting for the group in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new setting (true to enable auditing for the group, false to disable it).

function.name: group-get-rotate-audit-files
function.summary: This function returns the value for the rotate audit files setting from the specified group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.name: group-get-keep-audit-files

function.name: group-set-rotate-audit-files

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
The new audit level (must be one of never, daily, monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, sunday, monthly).

function.name: group-set-keep-audit-files
function.summary: This function changes the keep audit files setting for the group in the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
A number indicating the number of audit log files to keep before deleting them.

function.name: group-enable-audit-event-type
function.summary: This function changes the audit event type(s) enabled setting for the audit configuration.

The event types to enable (must be one of: "amp-usage" "audit-configuration-change" "audit-shutdown" "audit-startup" "authentication-failure" "concurrent-request-denial" "configuration-change" "document-execute" "document-insert" "document-read" "document-update" "estimate" "eval" "exists" "lexicon-read" "no-permission" "no-privilege" "permission-change" "request-blackout-denial" "role-change-failure" "search" "security-access" "server-restart" "server-shutdown" "server-startup" "user-configuration-change" "user-role-addition" "user-role-removal" ).

function.name: group-disable-audit-event-type
function.summary: This function changes the audit event type(s) enabled setting for the audit configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

The event types to disable (must be one of: "amp-usage" "audit-configuration-change" "audit-shutdown" "audit-startup" "authentication-failure" "concurrent-request-denial" "configuration-change" "document-execute" "document-insert" "document-read" "document-update" "estimate" "eval" "exists" "lexicon-read" "no-permission" "no-privilege" "permission-change" "request-blackout-denial" "role-change-failure" "search" "security-access" "server-restart" "server-shutdown" "server-startup" "user-configuration-change" "user-role-addition" "user-role-removal" ).

function.name: group-get-audit-event-type-enabled
function.summary: This function returns the audit event type's enabled setting for the audit configuration. A value of trueis returned is the specified event type is set. Otherwise falseis returned.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

The event type to check (must be one of: "amp-usage" "audit-configuration-change" "audit-shutdown" "audit-startup" "authentication-failure" "concurrent-request-denial" "configuration-change" "document-execute" "document-insert" "document-read" "document-update" "estimate" "eval" "exists" "lexicon-read" "no-permission" "no-privilege" "permission-change" "request-blackout-denial" "role-change-failure" "search" "security-access" "server-restart" "server-shutdown" "server-startup" "user-configuration-change" "user-role-addition" "user-role-removal" ).

function.summary: This function returns the roles excluded from auditing. If auditing has a "inclusion" restriction, this function returns the empty sequence.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.name: group-get-audit-included-roles
function.summary: This function returns the roles included from auditing. If auditing has a "exclusion" restriction, this function returns the empty sequence.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.name: group-set-audit-uri-restriction
function.summary: This function restricts the audit configuration by excluding or including by document uri(s).

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

function.name: group-get-audit-excluded-uris
function.summary: This function returns the uris excluded from auditing. If auditing has a "inclusion" restriction, this function returns the empty sequence.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
