function.name: group-get-audit-outcome-restriction
function.summary: This function returns whether auditing events are restricted by a success or failure outcome. Returns "success","failure", or "both"

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.name: mimetypes-add
function.summary: This function adds mimetypes to the configuration. This function always requires a server restart to take effect.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
A mimetype specification, typically the result of an admin:mimetypecall.

function.name: mimetypes-delete
function.summary: This function deletes mimetypes from the configuration. This function always requires a server restart to take effect.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
A mimetype specification, typically the result of an admin:mimetypecall.

function.name: mimetypes-get
function.summary: This function returns all the mimetypes from the configuration.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

function.name: mimetype
function.summary: This function constructs a mimetype specification.

params.param: The name of the mimetype.
The extension(s) for the mimetype.
A valid format for the mimetype. Must be on of: binary, xml, or text.

function.name: database-daily-backup
function.summary: This function constructs a daily scheduled database backup.

params.param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of days to elapse between each backup
The time of day of the backup, in 24:00:00 notation.
The maximum number of backups to keep. When you reach the specified maximum number of backups, the next backup will delete the oldest backup. Specify 0 to keep an unlimited number of backups.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

function.name: database-hourly-backup
function.summary: This function constructs a hourly scheduled database backup.

params.param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of hours to elapse between each backup.
The number of minutes after the hour to start the backup. Note that this setting does not add to the backup period value.
The maximum number of backups to keep. When you reach the specified maximum number of backups, the next backup will delete the oldest backup. Specify 0 to keep an unlimited number of backups.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

function.name: database-minutely-backup
function.summary: This function constructs a scheduled database backup on a number-of-minutes basis.

params.param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of minutes to elapse between each backup.
The maximum number of backups to keep. When you reach the specified maximum number of backups, the next backup will delete the oldest backup. Specify 0 to keep an unlimited number of backups.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

function.name: forest-hourly-backup
function.summary: This function constructs a hourly scheduled forest backup.

params.param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of hours to elapse between each backup
The number of minutes after the hour to start the backup. Note that this setting does not add to the backup period value.

function.name: forest-minutely-backup
function.summary: This function constructs a scheduled forest backup on a number-of-minutes basis.

params.param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of minutes to elapse between each backup

function.name: group-get-scheduled-tasks
function.summary: This function returns all of the tasks scheduled for the specified group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group on which the scheduled tasks are configured. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.

function.name: group-add-scheduled-task
function.summary: This function adds one or more scheduled tasks to the specified group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group on which the scheduled tasks are configured. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
One or more scheduled tasks, such as those created by the task-create functions.

function.name: group-delete-scheduled-task
function.summary: This function deletes one or more scheduled tasks from the specified group.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group on which the scheduled tasks are configured. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-idcall.
One or more scheduled tasks.

function.name: group-one-time-scheduled-task
function.summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked once, at a specific calendar day and time.

params.param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (files system) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The date and time on which the task is to start.
The id of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The id of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The id of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The id of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

function.name: group-monthly-scheduled-task
function.summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at monthly intervals.

params.param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (files system) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of months to elapse between each invocation of the module.
The day of the month to invoke the module.
The time of day (in 24:00 notation) to invoke the module.
The id of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The id of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The id of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The id of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

function.name: group-weekly-scheduled-task
function.summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at weekly intervals.

params.param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (files system) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of weeks to elapse between each invocation of the module.
One or more days on the specified week to invoke the module
The time of day (in 24:00 notation) to invoke the module.
The id of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The id of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The id of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The id of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

function.name: group-daily-scheduled-task
function.summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at daily intervals.

params.param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (files system) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of days to elapse between each invocation of the module.
The time of day (in 24:00 notation) to invoke the module.
The id of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The id of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The id of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The id of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

function.name: group-hourly-scheduled-task
function.summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at hourly intervals.

params.param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (filesystem) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of hours to elapse between each invocation of the module.
The number of minutes after the hour to invoke the module. This value must be 59 or less. Note that this setting does not add to the task-period value.
The id of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The id of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The id of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The id of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

function.name: group-minutely-scheduled-task
function.summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at intervals defined in terms of minutes.

params.param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (filesystem) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of minutes to elapse between each invocation of the module.
The id of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The id of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The id of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The id of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

function.name: appserver-get-ssl-certificate-template
function.summary: This function returns the id of the SSL certificate template used by the specified App Server. If no template is set for the App Server, 0 is returned.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-ssl-ciphers
function.summary: This function returns the SSL ciphers set for the App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-ssl-hostname

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-set-ssl-certificate-template

function.name: appserver-set-ssl-ciphers

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The SSL ciphers to set.

function.name: appserver-set-ssl-hostname
function.summary:
This function sets an SSL hostname for the specified App Server.
The SSL hostname should only be set when a proxy or load balancer is used to represent multiple servers. In this case, you can specify an SSL hostname with this function and all instances of the application server will identify themselves as that host.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The SSL hostname.

function.name: appserver-get-ssl-allow-sslv3

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-get-ssl-allow-tls
function.summary: This function returns true if the TLS protocol is enabled for the specified App Server, or false if TLS is disabled.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-set-ssl-allow-sslv3
function.summary: This function enables or disables the SSL v3 protocol for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-set-ssl-allow-tls
function.summary: This function enables or disables the TLS protocol for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.name: appserver-set-ssl-client-certificate-authorities
function.summary: This function sets one or more client certificate authorities that sign client certificates for the specified App Server. This function is typically used along with the pki:insert-trusted-certificatesand pki:get-trusted-certificate-idsfunctions to import trusted Certificate Authorities for client certificates.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.

function.summary: This function constructs a daily scheduled forest backup.

The number of days to elapse between each backup.

function.name: database-set-tf-normalization
function.summary: This function specifies whether to use the default term-frequency normalization ( scaled-log), which scales the term frequency based on the size of the document, or to use the unscaled-log, which uses term frequency as a function of the actual term frequency in a document, regardless of the document size.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new term-frequency normalization setting. Must be one of: scaled-logor unscaled-log.

function.name: database-get-tf-normalization
function.summary: This function returns the current term-frequency normalization setting for the database. The returned value is either ( scaled-log), which means to scale the term frequency based on the size of the document, or unscaled-log, which means to use term frequency as a function of the actual term frequency in a document, regardless of the document size.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

Boolean that indicates whether to connect to forests by name. If fn:true, forests will automatically connect to/from foreign forests of the same name. If false, forests must be individually configured to replicate to/from foreign forests. Individual forest settings override the database level setting.

This parameter controls how far (in seconds) the replica may fall behind before the master stops accepting updates. If contact with the foreign cluster is lost, a warning will be logged and master forests will permit updates to proceed with no enforcement of the lag limit.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

function.summary: This function configures the default output serialization method for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for the serialization method, one of xml, html, xhtml, text, or default.

function.name: appserver-set-output-byte-order-mark
function.summary: This function configures whether for the specified App Server the output sequence of octets is or is not to be preceded by a byte order mark by default.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for outputting a byte order mark, one of yes, no, or default.

function.name: appserver-set-output-cdata-section-namespace-uri
function.summary: This function sets the namespace URI for any CDATA section localnames configured for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A namespace URI for CDATA section elements.

function.name: appserver-set-output-cdata-section-localname
function.summary: This function sets the default element localname or list of element localnames to be output as CDATA sections for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A CDATA section element localname or space-separated list of CDATA section element localnames.

function.name: appserver-set-output-doctype-public
function.summary: This function configures a default public identifier to use on the emitted DOCTYPE for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A public identifier URI.

function.name: appserver-set-output-doctype-system
function.summary: This function configures a default system identifier to use on the emitted DOCTYPE for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A system identifier URI.

function.name: appserver-set-output-escape-uri-attributes
function.summary: This function configures whether or not to apply Unicode normalization, percent-encoding, and HTML escaping when serializing URI attributes by default for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for escaping serialized URI attributes, one of yes, no, or default.

function.name: appserver-set-output-include-content-type
function.summary: This function configures whether or not to include the content-type declaration when serializing nodes for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for including a content-type declaration, one of yes, no, or default.

function.name: appserver-set-output-indent
function.summary: This function configures whether or not to pretty-print (indent) typed XML (that is, XML for which there is an in-scope schema) output for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for indenting output for typed XML, one of yes, no, or default.

function.name: appserver-set-output-indent-untyped
function.summary: This function configures whether or not to pretty-print (indent) untyped XML (that is, XML for which there is no in-scope schema) output for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for indenting output for typed XML, one of yes, no, or default.

function.name: appserver-set-output-media-type
function.summary: This function sets the default serialization media type for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for output media type, a MIME type string such as text/xml.

function.name: appserver-set-output-normalization-form
function.summary: This function sets a Unicode normalization form to be applied by default to serialized output for the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for the output normalization form, one of none, NFC, NFD, or NFKD.

function.name: appserver-set-output-omit-xml-declaration
function.summary: This function configures whether serialized output for the specified App Server should omit the inclusion of an XML declaration by default.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for omitting the XML declaration, one of yes, no, or default.

function.name: appserver-set-output-standalone
function.summary: This function configures whether for the specified App Server an XML delcaration in serialized output should include a standaloneattribute by default.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
For a value of yesor no, include standalone= valuein the XML declaration; for a value of omit, omit standalone=.

function.name: appserver-set-output-undeclare-prefixes
function.summary: This function configures whether by default, serialization for the specified App Server should undeclare the namespace prefix of any child element that does not bind the prefix of its parent element.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
The default value for undeclaring prefixes, one of yes, no, or default.

function.name: appserver-set-output-version
function.summary: This function stipulates a version of the default serialization method associated with the specified App Server.

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-idcall.
A release version string, one of 1.0or 4.0.

function.name: appserver-set-output-include-default-attributes

function.name: database-add-foreign-database
function.summary: This function adds a foreign database to a database

params.param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id of the replica database to be added.
The id of the foreign cluster containing the replica host.
The id of the replica database.

function.name: database-delete-foreign-database
